p: The effects of Caragana turfanensis on neuroinflammation inhibition were evaluated by Song et al. Among the 36 compounds present in the extract, a new coumarin, caraganolide A (34), was observed ( Figure 3). The evaluation of each compound was performed on LPS-induced BV2 cells, and caraganolide A demonstrated an IC 50 of 1.01 ± 1.57 μg/mL, portraying the best activity among all isolated compounds, including in comparison to the positive control (minocycline) of 9.07 ± 0.86 μg/mL [ 74].
